content.title: Post-Thrombotic Syndrome
content.definition: Chronic venous insufficiency that develops following deep vein thrombosis, characterized by leg pain, swelling, and skin changes.

concepts.definition: Combination of residual venous obstruction and valvular reflux from thrombus-induced valve damage.
Validated clinical scoring system for diagnosis and severity grading of PTS.

clinical_features.wound_care: Compression, debridement, skin grafting for ulcers

clinical_features.quality_of_life: Significant impact on work capacity and daily activities

diagnostic_criteria.diagnosis: Villalta score ≥5 at least 6 months after DVT
diagnostic_criteria.imaging: Duplex to assess reflux and residual obstruction

content.statement: Post-Thrombotic Syndrome is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Venous that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
